title: Chris Martin‚Äôs George Michael tribute trashed
text:
GEORGE Michael was honoured at this year‚Äôs BRIT Awards - but the choice of performer left some viewers unhappy. 
Michael was shown on screen performing a posthumous duet with Coldplay‚Äôs Chris Martin. 
Before that, Michael‚Äôs former Wham! band mates Andrew Ridgeley, Pepsi and Shirlie first took to the stage first to recite their tear-jerking speech about the singer, who died on Christmas Day aged 53. Coldplay‚Äôs Chris Martin and former Wham! members paid tribute to George Michael. Source: AFP 
In the most emotional speech of the night, Ridgeley started by saying, ‚ÄúA supernova in a firmament of shining stars had been extinguished and it felt like the sky had fallen in.‚Äù 
Ridgeley also reminisced on the history of their band, which won two BRIT awards in the 1980s. 
‚ÄúIn 1975 we were two boys who happened to share a mutual sense of humour, a love of life-affirming music, the artists and record it gave birth to, and a shared sense that we understood it,‚Äù he said. 
Pepsi and Shirlie, who toured with the duo as their backup singers, struggled to hold back tears as they gave their part of the moving eulogy. 
‚ÄúWe always knew George was destined to become a star in his own right,‚Äù Pepsi said. ‚ÄúHis voice was stunning, pitch-perfect, and his performances spellbinding.‚Äù Singers Pepsi DeMacque from left, Andrew Ridgeley and Shirlie Holliman pay homage to George Michael on stage at the BRIT Awards. Source: AP 
‚ÄúGeorge was like a brother to me and I always be so proud of his incredible achievements,‚Äù said Shirlie through tears. 
Coldplay‚Äôs lead singer Chris Martin then took to the stage to perform Michael‚Äôs 1986 hit A Different Corner . Martin performed with a video recording of Michael. Source: Getty Images 
Dueting with a recording of Michael, Martin was accompanied by an orchestra of violinists and a video montage of the fallen singer‚Äôs life. 
While Martin did receive a tearful standing ovation from the O2 for his performance, Twitter wasn‚Äôt as kind, with many asking why exactly the Coldplay frontman had been chosen to pay tribute to the departed pop icon: #BRITs2017 when you think Chris Martin suddenly gets in tune, then you realise they are actually playing a video of #GeorgeMichael ‚Äî Stuart Borley (@StuBallBaggins) February 22, 2017 2/2 Chris Martin proved once again there is just no one like @georgemichael @BRITs Still, nice and so deserved tribute.... üíî ‚Äî AmandaNobel Edelsmid (@NobelAmanda) February 22, 2017 Chris Martin showing what an absolute bloody genius songwriter and singer #georgemichael was, by being nowhere near as good as him. #brits ‚Äî Jo Malley (@marciehatter) February 22, 2017 Why not just show George Michael singing it and leave Chris Martin out of it! #BRITs2017
